==Chinese==

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han simp|並}}, which is in turn from {{och-l|竝}}.

===Etymology 1===
{{zh-see|並||to be [[side by side]]; [[simultaneously]]; [[moreover]]}}

===Etymology 2===
{{zh-see|併||to [[combine]]}}

====Usage notes====
In ancient texts, {{lang|zh|并}} may be the same as {{och-l|併}}, but not {{och-l|並}}. {{lang|zh|並}} and {{lang|zh|併}} were differently pronounced in Old Chinese.
